item.title: What’s data got to do with it? We’re accepting applications for our third Data-Driven Journalism Academy. Apply, and find out…
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
Applications are now open for the third cohort of Code for South Africa’s Data-Driven Journalism Academy, which kicks off on September 12.

The post What’s data got to do with it? We’re accepting applications for our third Data-Driven Journalism Academy. Apply, and find out… appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Women’s Day 2016 meets Elections 2016: Women more important than ever
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
Political parties generally fielded fewer female ward candidates in the 2016 local government elections, suggesting that voters might be inclined to vote for men on the ward lists where individual candidates are directly elected. But South African voters appear to be proving political parties wrong: while the country has a long way to go in […]

The post Women’s Day 2016 meets Elections 2016: Women more important than ever appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The Panama Papers in Africa: how tax avoidance is robbing Africa of billions
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
Letitia Diergaardt is a receptionist for a battery-supplier in Windhoek, Namibia. One can almost picture her office: modest, a computer on her desk and hard copy accounting sheets, financial documents and debtors’ books neatly filed in cabinets. Diergaardt is also a director or owner of nine offshore companies in the British Virgin Islands, a tax […]

The post The Panama Papers in Africa: how tax avoidance is robbing Africa of billions appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Youth Day Timeline: The day that ignited the flames of freedom
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
June 16, 1976, 40 years ago today: a spark ignited by students on the dusty streets of Soweto set in motion a chain of events that would play a key role in the birth of a new democratic South Africa, 18 years later. That fatal day began with peaceful protests but soon escalated into bloodshed, […]

The post Youth Day Timeline: The day that ignited the flames of freedom appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
